title: Improved Obsolete Support
body:
The issue was created by @mattleibow from https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/feedback/issues/719
Problem 1
I think the support for displaying obsolete information could be improved a bit to more clearly indicate what is obsolete and what is the next step.
For example, take a look at this page:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/skiasharp.skpicture.bounds?view=skiasharp-1.59.3

Right now, all I see is the big obsolete warning and I get scared. What should I do? Where do I go? Is Microsoft killing Silverlight and Windows Phone? 😉
Because I am an expert, my eyes scroll to the code block and read the attribute text, and all is well. It appears that I need to use the new property.
Solution 1 - A
The first step might be to just copy the text from the attribute into the warning box. This might be a quick and easy fix for most APIs. We could even hide that with a flag in the configuration.
Solution 1 - B
There might be a way to actually add some "obsolete warning" documentation somewhere...
Problem 2
Another issue with the docs is that at the type or namespace level, I cannot see what is obsolete and thus have to click through:

Spot the obsolete property! You can't!
